title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls open 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts for City Council and mayoral elections.
Mayor Michelle Wu runs unopposed; key City Council races include four at-large seats with eight candidates.
Ballots available in multiple languages; mail-in voters must return ballots to drop boxes or City Hall by 8 p.m.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Casey Mittelstadt, moved to the Bruins' second line, has helped improve the team's offensive play significantly.
The Bruins' second line outscored opponents 4-2 in 66 minutes of ice time over the last seven games.
Both Viktor Arvidsson and Mittelstadt have contributed heavily, with Arvidsson scoring three goals in five games.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet of the Boston Red Sox is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award after leading the league in innings and strikeouts.
Crochet finished his first season with the Red Sox with an 18-5 record and a 2.59 ERA, excelling in a playoff game.
Boston rookie Roman Anthony is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year after hitting .292 with 8 home runs and 32 RBIs in 71 games.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots prioritize acquiring an edge rusher before the NFL trade deadline to strengthen their pass-rushing corps.
New England targets a running back to address injuries and bolster their rushing attack, considering options like Cleveland's Jerome Ford.
Linebacker and secondary depth are additional concerns, with Robert Spillane improving but the team still seeking versatile defensive additions.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots have given up 34 sacks this season, ranking second-most in the NFL.
Drake Maye has endured 12 sacks over the last two games, tying his total from last season.
Center Garrett Bradbury and others emphasize improving pass protection to prevent further quarterback pressure.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel in Boston settled a discrimination complaint after a woman was wrongfully accused of being a man.
The hotel agreed to update anti-discrimination policies and donate $10,000 to an LGBTQIA2S+ non-profit.
The woman's lawyer plans a civil lawsuit, claiming damages from false accusations and emotional distress.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracted accusations against the Patriots for simulating Atlanta's snap count in a 24-23 loss.
The controversy, dubbed 'clapgate,' centered on claims that clapping by the Patriots misled Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the allegations, attributing any noise to the crowd rather than intentional misdirection.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of his Red Sox contract with two years and $80 million remaining, entering free agency.
Bregman, 32, hit .273 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs across 114 games for Boston in the 2025 season.
Red Sox face competition for Bregman from teams like the Tigers and Mariners interested in his veteran leadership and defense.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim to boost their 7-2 team with possible trades before the NFL deadline on Tuesday at 4 p.m.
New England targets reinforcements, but remains cautious about giving up future assets despite potential deals for top talent.
Patriots consider trading OLB Anfernee Jennings, while actively seeking edge rushers and other key positions.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, named after Amanda's favorite tree.
Lindholm returned from a lower-body injury, contributing to the Bruins' 5-1-0 record with him in the lineup.
Bruins' defense improved significantly with Lindholm back, cutting goals allowed from 4.25 to 2.3 per game.
